Description:Ã¢â‚¬â€¹ When playing KSP on a remote machine with Steam In-Home Streaming, the right mouse button will not rotate the camera during a mission or while interacting with the orbital map.

How to reproduce:

*Launch game on remote computer using IHS

*Start a new mission or select one in progress

*Attempt to control camera using the right mouse button

Notes:

*Right-clicking to select modules still works correctly, however you cannot right click to set maneuvers in the orbital map.

*Right-clicking to rotate the camera works fine in the space center overview, but this is the only situation in which it works.

*Have tested right mouse button functionality in several other games using IHS with no problems, have also tried three different mice.

I believe this issue is related to another one: The invisible mouse pointer problem. In trying to play KSP via in-home streaming, I discovered that if the host computer does not have a mouse connected, then you will not be able to see a mouse pointer when streaming a game (Win 8.1 host). However, the right-click-drag mechanic DOES work, even in KSP. I connected a garbage mouse to the host PC to fix the invisible pointer (which worked), but then I lost the ability to move the camera with the right-click-drag motion. As it is, I can drag the camera with the mouse or see my mouse pointer, but not both.
